page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: Most of the land is used for pasture or hay crops except for 9 fields of rape and 2 fields of turnips.There are 26 farms.21 farmers keep sheep,15 keep cattle,7 rear calves,12 keep hens,14 have sheep dogs,2 keep goats,3 keep ducks,1 has geese and 3 keep horses. 3 farms have milking cows. The milk is collected from the farms daily by lorry-tanker and taken to a dairy. lambing time is March to May. Some sheep graze the moor. Ewes are brought into fields and barns. Most farmers shear their own sheep and help each other.Sheep shearing is in June and July.Dipping in August.Most stock is bought and sold at Bakewell Market.Hay making is in August.Sometimes lambs die in snow.Rams are called"tups". Orphan lambs are called"cade"lambs.
